attributes.additional_details:
Elections in 300 constituency seats based on the FPTP and 300 seats  based PR system

PR would be based on each party's share of vote in each region

PR seats won by party in each region go to their best losing candidates with the highest number of votes in that region. If there is no candidate, they can nominate member

After regional PR allocation, 50 seats should also be allocated to party with highest share of national vote to their remaining best losing candidates at national level.
attributes.background:
Divide the country into 300 almost equal constituencies, based on last official population census figures, with a difference of not more than +10% to -10% depending on local factors.  This should be reviewed every 20 or 30 years. 

Identify the regions like Wales, Scotland & North West England
